titleStmt.title: R. Coulthand to James R. Page
CWG2311

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: Some time ago you wrote to me that the citizens of Sharpsburg had forwarded a petition to his Excellency Gov. Bramlette for the appointment of Mr C. P. Vanpelt as Justice of the peace in place of James S. Rainey Esq removed from the county, Enclosed find a copy. of the order certifying the vacancy and who another petition from the citizens asking for the appointment of Mr Joseph Pattens. I am acquainted with Mr. Pattens and know him to be in every way qualified to fill the office and hope his Excellency will favor the enclosed petitions

Very Respectfully
R Coulthand Clk
Bath County Court

Jas R Page Esq
Ass't Secty
Frankfort Ky
